description: Third-semester Greek students translate selections from Plato's dialogues (<I>Apology,
Crito, Phaedo) while reviewing vocabulary, grammar, and syntax. Topics for class
discussion include the life and death of Socrates and the significance of the dialogues
as works of literature.  Offered annually in the fall semester. Also counts toward linguistic
studies concentration. Prerequisite: GREEK 112 or equivalent.
